p: The viable cell counts in SPE and SPW yogurt during fermentation are shown in Fig. 1C and 1F. They ranged from 7.49 to 9.77 Log 10 (CFU/g) and 7.43 to 9.99 Log 10 (CFU/g), respectively. The number of viable cells in SPE was not significantly different from that in SPW yogurt. However, the number of viable cells in SPE and SPW yogurt was slightly lower than that in plain yogurt at the end of fermentation. It has been reported that in yogurt supplemented with cinnamon ethanol extract, the viable cell counts were marginally decreased at the end of fermentation ( Choi et al., 2016). However, yogurt fermented with Korean traditional plant extracts showed an increase in lactic acid bacteria count during fermentation ( Joung et al., 2016; Jung et al., 2016).
